text: Draft at the brewpub. Cloudy gold in colour with moderate carbonation. Aromas are of profoundly juicy sweet citrus, gooseberry, and flaked grain. Flavors are of tangelo, mango, pink grapefruit, raw hop cone, and more flaked grain. Medium bodied with a low but grassy bitterness. Very enjoyable.

Crowler at Ryans Pours a hazy orange body with thick white head and lacing. Nose is soapy citrus hops. Mouthfeel is medium to light bodied with notes of fruity hops, soft melon, pineapple, mango, grains, soft cheese and light dank grainy character.

Crowler from Red. Says 6% on the can... very cloudy golden orange with lace. Juicy Mosaic nose, tropical fruit, mango, papaya, dank, orange, grapefuit. Low malt. Sweet and juicy, orange-mango-papaa juice with a bit of malt. Like it, but does it taste like beer? Bit of cracker, honey, biscuit. Touch of hop spiciness and pepper. Very tasty, but A little too much just like fruit juice for me to really appreciate it. Quite sweet as well.

Current version on tap at brewery is 6%m & doesnt use the word session.Aromas of lemon, orange, sawdust & egg yolks. Flavor more to lemon, honey. slightly sweet, bubbly. Interesting texture. deliberately cloudy. citrus finish.

Hazy deep golden with a foamy white top. Fruity mango and piney and galaxy hoppy juicy nose with a pale malty fluffy malt base. Smooth flavor thats gently brisk yet fluffy, juicy yet somewhat refrained and not super tropical. Lovely bright fruit and light pineapple and hoppy juicy bitterness. Balanced but hoppy yet juicy and fruity-hoppy. Smooth and tasty as.

Keg @ Great Notion. Soupy, hazy light gold pour with a small head. Nose is big and bright. Lots of herbal / floral hop character in addition to some tropical fruit. Dank. citrus. Flavor is only lightly bitter. Strong herb. Some pineapple. Very soft, pillowy mouthfeel. Light carb. Nice.
Draught at brewery. Super hazy juicy flavorful IPA with basically no malt. Very good overall.

On tap at Great Notion. Nose is almost all Mosaic -- tropical fruit (mango and papaya). Cloudy medium raw apple juice color. Flavors, again Mosaic, moderate bittering, some citrus, and some maltiness emerges from mid palate. Medium body. Very nice, but its pretty much a one dimensional brew (Mosaic juice).

Crowler on NYE, pours a hazy golden orange with large head. Notes of orange skunk #1, tangerine, cheese, mango, grapefruit, and other types of tropical juice. Medium bodied. Immensely dank and crushable mosaic hop juice from Great Notion. They really impressed me this session.

Crowler from the brewery, thanks Poisoneddwarf for picking this up- Pours extremely hazy light orange with a medium soapy white head and some lace. Aroma is juicy, grapefruit, mango, tropical fruits. The taste is juicy again, grapefruit, mango, very tropical, low level bitterness, sweet and dry mixed. Tasty beer.

Crowler from the brewery, filled two days ago. Brilliant aroma is very citrusy, some tropical fruit. Pours extremely milky orange with a long-sustaining bone white head with curtains of lace. Taste is lightly bitter with juicy citrus flavors. Carbonation seems soft. Really tasty, although Ripe seems a bit better.
Great Notion, Portland. Thin foam, clearish gold. Most fruity hop. Down right the middle after their fruitier options. Lighter pine-hop, lemon tea. Some clean dry-bitter. Clean, solid beer.

Crowler shared at Mikkeller and Friends. Thanks Tom & Tarax! Pours a hazy gold with a big guava and papaya forward nose. Some tangerine and dank notes as it warms. Nice big juicy mouthfeel with tons of fruit on the palate. Easy drinking with a ton of tropical fruit that lingers on the finish. Very little perceived bitterness.

Portland, Or - on tap at Great Notion. Hazy, med gold pour, light off white head. Pineapple and tangy cat urine in the aroma.Flavor is tangy with some orange zest, pineapple, a touch of  spearmint. Thickish mouthfeel.
Crowler shared at capitol beer. Pours haze with lots of citrus. Clean ale yeast finish.

32 oz crowler, filled at the brewery. Huge thanks to luttonm for handling the courier services on this one. I owe you! I was waiting to share this with somebody, but like many IPAs, I felt the clock was ticking in the crowler. Besides, after the first sip of this, I knew 32 oz would last me about an inning of the baseball game, especially if the Ms cant seem to record an out. The better the beer, the worse the game goes. Its a tough battle for me. Pours a shiny golden color with a lasting archipelago foam head. Im surprised this is a solitary Mosaic hopped beer. A much juicier, tropical fruit profile than I have picked up from other single hops of the same. I expected the juicy side of this based on the name, but that was before I knew anything really about it. First impression is an orange slices, super fruit constant. Orange juice like late mouthfeel. Makes me feel like this beer would go great for breakfast. I always preferred a juicy session IPA over a coffee beer when it comes time to drinking beer before the tap places open up. What a perfect fit to the category this one is. Second pint of this crowler was even better than the first. So much delicious fruity hop flavor that keeps you downing this beer. In no way does this taste like it is a session. It has a full IPA flavor and a good amount of bitterness throughout. So many things are right with this beer. Its a shame I havent been to Great Notion to try one of these fantastic beers on site. That being said, with this one beer, you have made a fan. Excellent stuff.
ahhh big thanks to Aaron. One of the best IPAs on the west coast. Very juicy, hop rich body, light bitterness, thick frothy mouthfeel.
Dark copper. Sweet and juicy. Mango. Tropical. Shared a flight w joey at brewery.

Crowler @ Monkish. Murky golden beer with a white head. With a name like this, I expected some serious juice. Instead, its more of just a kind of straightforward, "traditional" session IPA/pale ale thats ugly. Lots of citrus rind, some pine, a bit of dank, and herbs. Big time orange peel here. Moderate bitterness. Decent mouthfeel, at least. Has a bit of stone fruit and tropical fruit sweetness, too. Some notes of zesty citrus. Its a nice enough beer, but not anything groundbreaking.
Can. Pours hazy golden with a medium white head. Notes of sweet melons, mangoes, tangerine, citrus, grassy, orange peel.
Sample @ Blåbær 16, from crowler. LIght hazy golden pour with a generous head. Tons of mangoes and mandarins, some floral notes, grassy and some orange juice.
(En fût à la source): Pêches, mangues, une touche de chlorophylle et une amertume fondante. Si loin physiquement de Tree House mais gustativement si près.

Crowler. Thanks, S! Pours a hazy bright orange amber with a loose white head that sticks around. Big tangy orange and tangerine nose. Creamy medium body with lively carb. Lightly toasted caramel with citric hop acids on the mid palate. Solid.

One I had said 6%. Not sure how that constitutes session. Maybe ask Chazz Cordova or Brent enloe. They could probably tell you. At least it's east coast style. Nose of pencil erasers and papaya, soft grain and white sugar. Pours hazy golden yellow white head. Flavors are mostly pencil erasers papaya and some juicy hops. Dry finish of rubber and dank. Lighter bodied than their others but the whole pencil eraser took away a pleasant experience otherwise.

Tap at the brewery.

A: Cloudy gold color, thin white head. 

N: Minerality, cracker, grapefruit, pineapple, and some lemon zest. Hints of orange. Pine and earth.

T: Bitter and sweet in proportion.

M: Light body, no alcohol. Crisp carbonation.

O: A very fruity session IPA. Theres a lot to like here,
Crowler. Yellow pour with light head. Herbal, light grassy and citrus aromas. Flavors are very light, grassy and citrus notes.
Crowler- pours yellow white head- nose and taste of citrus, orange peel, toasted malt, and lemon- medium body

Draft. Just a smidge paler than its big brother, Juicebox. Aroma leads with smooth tangerine and mango, with a fresh grassy note swirling in the background. Very juicy. More dank and resinous hops in the flavor; absolutely sticky with orange peel and pine resin and weed. Finishes with a citrusy tang and just a hint of alcohol.

Draught @ Great Notion, Portland, OR. Pours hazy cloudy orange with a smooth white head. Aroma of juicy tropical fruits, zesty grapefruit, pineapples and citrus. Taste is super smooth, juicy fruity and hoppy with loads of tropical notes, mango, citrus and zesty grapefruit. Finish is super juicy, tropical fruity and hoppy with some grapefruit, mango and peach. Tasty and quaffable hop juice.

UPDATED: OCT 19, 2016 On tap at the De Garde Anniversary. Pours a cloudy orange with small frothy white head that diminishes to nothing. The aroma is strong grapefruit and floral. Medium mouth, juicy, dank hop, grapefruit, light bitterness, crushable, really enjoyed this.

On tap at De garde anniversary. Pours out a hazy gold topped with a white head. nose is great big tropical fruit juicy hops tangerine citrus a little pine and plenty of nice malty sweetness. taste is more of the tropical fruit hops a nice rounded easy drinker.
Tap at brewery. Pours Hazy orangish with off white head. Aroma is citrus. Taste is juicy hoppy citrus with a piney finish. Really good. Was bummed Juice box wasnt flowing that day.

One of the better session IPAs we've had. Lots of citrus. Pours a nice bright Oran's with a white head. Smells of orange rind, tropical fruit and cumin. Taste is very orange, a deep taste for a session. Had on tap at the brewery.

On tap at Great Notion, pours an opaque golden yellow with a small white head. Aroma brings out dry piney hops, tropical fruits and bready malt. Flavour is super fresh, with loads of tropical fruits, dry hopping and dry citrus. Dry and citrusy, with wonderful depth. Excellent.

On tap @ Great Notion. Pours heavily hazy golden yellow with thick lacy white head. Aroma is thin pale malt, big lemony citrus hops. Taste is nice lemon/orange citrus notes up front, grainy earthy malt lingers through the finish. This is close to escaping the session IPA curse, but shows a bit harsh through the finish. Not quite as good as Ripe or Juice Box, and hardly a season IPA in the usual sense of the word. Still, tasty beer.
On tap at the brewery. Pours a cloudy yellow color with a large white head. A big sweet fruity citrus nose. The flavor is sharp lemon, funky late boil goodness. Citrus, lemongrass, biscuit. Lovely.
